page.title: 01The block-a brief outline.
page.content: The block covers an area which is predominantly arable farmland with a significant amount of managed grazing and paddocks,part of the studs which surround nearby Newmarket.Most of the land is owned by the Duke of Sutherland. There are three villages in the block;Stetchworth,Woodditton and Saxon Street.Although their postal address is Newmarket Suffolk,they are,in fact,in Cambridgeshire. Stetchworth serves as a focal point since it has a Primary School,Old Peoples' Sheltered Housing and a recently built multi-purpose centre,known as the Ellesmere Centre, containing sports facilities,community shop and rooms set aside for use as Doctor's surgery and other health care.The centre was built to serve the needs of the six surrounding parishes.
